title: Customer Care Agent - Marketplace (CC 0321)
description:
At Skroutz, we have a vision to make everyone's life better by creating the most trustworthy, trouble-free, and easy to use online discovery and shopping experience. We want to provide this experience not only to our users and partners, but also to our team members.

Today we are going through one of the most exciting times for Skroutz. We are rapidly transitioning to a marketplace model, we constantly invest in technology and innovation and we acquired MyJobNow Delivery to enter in the last mile market.

We firmly believe that people drive our business forward and we strive daily to build a powerful team that shares the same passion and enthusiasm for eCommerce and technology.


How will you contribute to Skroutz vision

We are looking for a Customer Support Agent to join our Marketplace team. Our Marketplace Support team operates 7/7 (8 hours/shift on rotation, night shifts excluded), in order to timely handle incoming operational issues that our customers might face while using Skroutz Cart.

Here at Skroutz, our customers are at the heart of everything we do, which means that we try to get things right for them first time, every time. Our Marketplace team strives to make our customer's journey with us something we're proud of.


What you will be doing

  • Ensure high levels of customer satisfaction through excellent after sales service.
  • Assess customers needs and provide assistance and information on delivery orders, or returns and refunds.
  • Create positive rapport and working relationships with merchants by providing daily support and guidance.
  • Manage relevant web content by enriching product descriptions, characteristics and specifications.
  • Maintain business relations with partners.
requirements:
• Bachelor’s degree
  • Proven work experience in a customer support role in eCommerce environment
  • Excellent PC and typing skills
  • Familiarity with CRM systems, helpdesks and practices
  • Customer orientation and ability to adapt/respond to different types of characters
  • Solid communication and interpersonal skills
  • Ability to multi-task, prioritize, and manage time effectively
  • Basic understanding of sales principles and customer service practices
  • Working knowledge of customer and market dynamics and requirements
  • A friendly and energetic personality with customer service focus

title: Senior Product Designer - Partners Platform (SDP 0421)
description:
At Skroutz, we have a vision to make everyone's life better by creating the most trustworthy, trouble-free, and easy to use online discovery and shopping experience. We want to provide this experience not only to our users and partners, but also to our team members.

Today we are going through one of the most exciting times for Skroutz. We are rapidly transitioning to a marketplace model, we constantly invest in technology and innovation and we acquired MyJobNow Delivery to enter in the last mile market.

We firmly believe that people drive our business forward and we strive daily to build a powerful team that shares the same passion and enthusiasm for eCommerce and technology.

The Team

The Partners Platform group at Skroutz is committed to offering trouble-free and seamless eCommerce experience to 8500 (and counting) merchants with over 5 Million products to grow their online or offline business.
We are organized in small, talented and fully fledged teams. Backend and Frontend Engineers, Tech Leads, Designers and Product Managers work closely together to tackle hard problems efficiently and build a strong merchant value proposition with new features and services.

  • Our main product Skroutz Merchants is a collection of tools, dashboards and services that help merchants in their day-to-day workflow to unlock the full potential of Skroutz platform.
  • We have built our own Skroutz Analytics platform that aggregates eCommerce data from Skroutz partners’/shops’ websites and provides meaningful time series insights to merchants.
  • We have developed our own efficient billing systems to meet our commercial needs, based on redirection traffic analysis (Cost Per Click) and order attribution (Cost Per Sale).
  • Last but not least we provide a set of internal tools and automated processes alongside a well-integrated CRM to our beloved Commercial team helping them to support merchants at any stage of their journey to success.

How will you contribute to Skroutz vision

We are looking to hire a talented Product Designer, passionate about designing amazing yet simple user-centered experiences. You will be responsible for early-stage research and ideation, through implementation and iteration towards building products for the web, mobile web and apps.

What you will be doing

  • Own all sides of design from concept to launch: storyboards, user flows, mockups, prototypes, and pixel perfect assets
  • Conduct user studies, competitive research and usability tests
  • Work closely with developers to see design through to implementation
  • Request early feedback through rapid prototypes or low fidelity wireframes
  • Develop, maintain and create pixel perfect designs, mockups and specifications as needed, adhering to brand guidelines
  • Maintain consistency in visual elements and ensure that our design system and philosophy is applied across the product
  • Collaborate with internal teams; communicate thoughts and expertise to the rest of the team
  • Stay on top of new technology and trends in mobile UI/UX designs
requirements:
• Minimum 3 years experience in a relevant position
  • Excellent Portfolio of UI/UX design solutions across a spectrum of platforms and services
  • Experience of working in a cross-discipline team environment
  • Experience in user research, usability studies, personas
  • Degree in Digital or Graphic Design (optional)
  • Proficiency in relevant creative tools (Sketch, Adobe XD, Figma)
  • Familiarity with Abstract, Zeplin, Photoshop, Illustrator, prototyping tools
  • Demonstrated experience working with a design system, its curation, maintenance, and dissemination
  • Highly detail oriented with a drive for perfection down to the last pixel
  • Self-motivated to prioritise and manage workload and meet critical project deadlines
  • Positive attitude with a creative, solution-driven mindset
  • Familiarity with HTML, CSS & Javascript (optional)

*Please make sure that you have included in your application a sample link of your UI/UX Portfolio. Applications with no portfolio will not be assessed further.

**Please note that this opening concerns an onsite job, located in Athens, Attica, Greece.

title: Frontend Developer - Skroutz Last Mile (FD 0621)
description:
Skroutz Last Mile is “running” fast.

Our vision is to revolutionize the eCommerce Last Mile experience in Greece and become a prominent reason for the end to end consumer experience through Skroutz. Our mission is to manage and distribute Skroutz Marketplace orders.

We provide the necessary technical tools in order to manage the fleet and deliver the orders to all Skroutz users quickly and efficiently.

What we are looking for

We are looking for a Frontend Engineer with a strong technical background and a “get-things-done” attitude who is eager to learn and apply new exciting technologies. You will be part of a small, talented and motivated team, tackle hard problems and have freedom to innovate and provide novel solutions.

Technologies we use

Our main stack is Ruby for the backend - using the Ruby on Rails framework - with Javascript (ES6) and VueJS for the frontend. Our main storage is a Postgres database. Our everyday goal is to pick the best tool possible in order to deliver optimal results!

Examples of your daily tasks

  • Build tools used by other members of the team or clients
  • Identify inefficiencies on the software used by the team and provide better solutions
  • Build efficient interfaces for managing complex operational problems
  • Collaborate with experienced engineers
requirements:
Your Skills & Experience

Experience

  • At least (3) years of working experience as a Frontend Engineer in a professional setting
  • Very good knowledge of JavaScript
  • Experience with VueJS
  • Experience with HTTP protocol and APIs
  • Knowledge of current trends and best practices in front-end architecture, including performance optimization, accessibility, and usability
  • Good understanding of UX design principles and methodologies

Skills

  • Intrigued by the product as much as by the technology
  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Easy going attitude, good communication skills, and team spirit

We would appreciate if you have

  • Familiarity with the latest JavaScript features (ES6+)
  • Familiarity with Vuex
  • Familiarity with CSS and Sass
  • Comfort in TDD and other testing practices
  • Worked with a version control system (preferably Git)
  • An eye for detail and a sense of design
  • Shareable open source contributions or personal projects will help us in the evaluation process

How will you contribute to Skroutz vision

The Partners Platform group at Skroutz is committed to offering trouble-free and seamless eCommerce experience to 8500 (and counting) merchants with over 5 Million products to grow their online or offline business.

  • Introduce new features and products to Skroutz users in order to boost merchant value proposition.

  • Boost our Marketplace service offerings to further expand our eCommerce solution for brick-and-mortar shops.

  • Comfort with TDD and other testing practices.

  • Contributed to open-source projects.
